title: OCR using Tess4J on Ubuntu
description: This tutorial shows how to read text from images with OCR using Tess4J on Ubuntu
author: Simon Scholz

children.value: Tess4J is a Java wrapper for Tesseract OCR. It provides Java and Kotlin APIs for doing OCR on images.

Tesseract is an open source OCR engine. It is available for Linux, Windows and macOS.
This is the actual OCR engine, which Tess4J uses under the hood.

props.className: language-bash shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai
props.code:
# using apt
sudo apt install tesseract-ocr
# using nala
sudo nala install tesseract-ocr

children.value: For certain operations Tess4J requires leptonica, which is a library for image processing and image analysis.

props.className: language-bash shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai
props.code:
# using apt
sudo apt install libleptonica-dev
# using nala
sudo nala install libleptonica-dev

children.value: In this example we will install the german language data:

props.className: language-bash shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai
props.code:
# using apt
sudo apt install tesseract-ocr-deu
# using nala
sudo nala install tesseract-ocr-deu

as input, which is pretty handy if you want to do ocr on images in memory, e.g., on a web server.

If you want to use the latest version of the language data you can clone the tessdata repository.
But this repository is quite big (about 5Â GB) and you will need to set the datapath for Tess4J.

props.className: language-bash shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai
props.code:
# using https
git clone https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tessdata.git

# using ssh
git clone git@github.com:tesseract-ocr/tessdata.git

props.className: language-kotlin shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai

children.value: to point to the cloned tessdata repository.
Now let's have a look at some additional configuration options for Tesseract.

props.className: language-kotlin shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai

children.value: // set language to german and english
// set ocr engine mode to default
Here we specified multiple languages using
We also set the ocr engine mode to default using
The dpi is set to 300 using
And we only recognize numbers using

.
Feel free to restrict the characters according to your needs.
The following example creates a text and a pdf document from each image.

props.className: language-kotlin shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai

children.value:
Note that the output path must not contain the file extension, because the file extension is added automatically depending on the output format.
This will create the respective txt and pdf files in the output folder.
Just have a look at the

enum to see which output file formats are supported.
The nice thing about pdf generation is that the text is search- and selectable in the pdf, but the image is still visible.
This is pretty handy since the majority of images do not only contain text, but also some kind of graphics.
Find position of text in image
The following example shows how to find the position of text in an image.

props.className: language-kotlin shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai

children.value: Getting this information is pretty handy, if you want to do some kind of image analysis.

In case the images have a standardized format, you can only look at the position of the text and ignore the rest of the image.
The next sections will show how to do this.
Targeting specific areas of an image

The following example shows how to target specific areas of an image.
The doOCR method can take a
as second parameter, which specifies the area of the image to be analyzed.

props.className: language-kotlin shiki shiki-themes github-light github-dark monokai

children.value: With this it is less likely that the ocr engine will recognize text, which is not relevant for your purpose.
You can try to find the right area by using the
method, which was shown in the previous section and then use the
class to create a rectangle, which contains the text you are interested in.
